censuses</topcClas>         <topcClas>Social indicators and quality of life - Society and culture</topcClas>         <topcClas>Social and occupational mobility - Social stratification and groupings</topcClas>       </subject>       <abstract><p>Abstract copyright UK Data Service and data collection copyright owner.</p>The <i> Census 2001: Small Area Microdata</i> SAM is a 5% sample of individuals for all countries of the UK, with 2.96 million cases. Local Authority is the lowest level of geography for England and Wales, Council Areas for Scotland and Parliamentary Constituencies for Northern Ireland. The Scilly Isles have been merged with Penwith and the City of London with Westminster. Orkney and Shetland are merged into one area. All other areas are identified. The median sample size for an authority is 5,600 records and nearly eighty authorities have more than 10,000 records. The amount of individual detail in the SAM is less than in the 2001 Individual Licenced Sample of Anonymised Records (I-SAR)(see under SNs 7205 and 7206) because of the greater geographical detail in the SAM. <br> <br> <i>Caveat - Students:</i><br> As with the Individual SAR, the SAM includes those enumerated in a communal establishment and also full-time students who were enumerated at an address that was not their usual term-time residence. For the latter there is only individual-level information on age, sex, marital status and full-time student status. It is recommended that these students are not included in any analyses as they do not form part of the usual residents population base. <br> <br> This dataset contains 88 variables; a version designed for imputation analysis, which contains an extra 67 imputation flag variables, is available under SN 7208.<br> <br> </abstract>       <abstract><B>Main Topics</B>:<br>The dataset includes information on households, age, gender, ethnicity, health, disability, employment status, housing, amenities, family type, caring, geography, social class, education, distance to work, workplace, labour force, hours worked, migration and population demographics.<br> </abstract>       <sumDscr>         <timePrd event="single" date="2001-01-01T00:00:00Z">2001</timePrd>         <nation>United Kingdom</nation>         <geogUnit>Unitary Authorities (England)</geogUnit>         <geogUnit>Council Areas</geogUnit>         <geogUnit>Westminster Parliamentary Constituencies</geogUnit>         <anlyUnit>Individuals</anlyUnit>         <universe>National</universe>         <universe>5% sample of individuals enumerated in households and communal establishments in the 2001 Census.</universe>         <dataKind>Numeric data</dataKind>         <dataKind> Individual (micro) level</dataKind>       </sumDscr>     </stdyInfo>     <method>       <dataColl>         <timeMeth>Cross-sectional (one-time) study</timeMeth>         <sampProc>The sample includes people in wholly imputed households, people in a household where another person(s) is imputed, people who were imputed in a household that was counted as well as the majority of people in wholly counted households.</sampProc>         <deviat>2,964,871 cases</deviat>         <collMode>Compilation or synthesis of existing material</collMode>         <sources />         <weight>No weighting used.</weight>         <cleanOps>A*</cleanOps>       </dataColl>     </method>     <dataAccs>       <setAvail>         <accsPlac>UK Data Service Census support</accsPlac>       </setAvail>       <useStmt>         <specPerm>UK: standard conditions; non-UK: depositor permission</specPerm>         <restrctn>The depositor has specified that registration is required and standard conditions of use apply. The depositor may be informed about usage.<br>Additional special conditions of use also apply. See terms and conditions for further information.<p>In addition, the UK Data Service is required to request permission from the depositor prior to supplying the data to non-UK residents.</restrctn>         <contact><a href=http://www.ukdataservice.ac.uk/help/get-in-touch.aspx>Get in touch</a></contact>       </useStmt>     </dataAccs>     <othrStdyMat>       <relStdy>7205 Census 2001: Individual Licenced Sample of Anonymised Records (I-SAR) </relStdy>       <relStdy>7206 Census 2001: Individual Licenced Sample of Anonymised Records for Imputation Analysis (I-SAR) </relStdy>       <relStdy>7208 Census 2001: Small Area Microdata for Imputation Analysis (SAM) </relStdy>       <relStdy>7209 Census 2001: Controlled Access Microdata Sample Test File (CAMS) </relStdy>       <relStdy>5278 2001 Census: Special Licence Household Sample of Anonymised Records (SL-HSAR) </relStdy>       <relPubl>   </relPubl>       <relPubl>   </relPubl>       <othRefs>Language Of Study Description: English</othRefs>       <othRefs>Language Of Study Documentation: English</othRefs>     </othrStdyMat>   </stdyDscr> </codeBook>
